page.title: 10Greenbooth Reservoir
page.content: Just above Norden is a reservoir which used to be the site of Greenbooth village. On the lower dam is a plaque commemorating the little village. The village had a chapel, a school and a small shop as its main features. It sprang up with the industrial revolution and died with it. The mill and surrounding area was owned by the Hutchinsons. Mrs. Hutchinson came round most days to inspect cleanliness in the homes. The school was so small that it was run by only two teachers. The methodist preacher John Wesley often stayed at a farmhouse above Greenbooth. A small methodist chapel which he helped to erect was knocked down with the rest of the village in 1937.
